page.title: 17RAILWAYS AND BRIDGES
page.content: ABOUT 1 SQUARE KM. IS OCCUPIED BY RAILWAYS. MOST OF THEM ARE USED BY FREIGHT TRAINS ALTHOUGH PASSENGER TRAINS ALSO USE THE LEEDS/SHEFFIELD LINE PASSING THROUGH BARNSLEY AND WOMBWELL. SOME LINES HAVE BEEN CLOSED RECENTLY AS MORE GOODS ARE BEING CARRIED ON THE ROAD NETWORK. THE AREA IS ALSO CRISS-CROSSED BY NUMEROUS ROADS, RIVERS AND CANALS, AND AS A RESULT THERE ARE AT LEAST 2O MAJOR BRIDGES - 4 RAIL OVER RAIL; 7 ROAD OVER RAIL; 1 ROAD UNDER RAIL; 4 ROAD OVER CANALS OR RIVERS; 4 RAIL OVER CANALS OR RIVERS. THE BRIDGES ARE USUALLY THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONCERN WHICH HAD THEM CONSTRUCTED AND THE SOUTH YORKSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL HAD A STAFF OF 3 INSPECTORS CHECKING THEIR SAFETY ALL THE TIME AND FOR 1985/6 Â£5OO,OOO HAD BEEN SET ON ONE SIDE FOR BRIDGE MAINTENANCE.
